The Eye of the World watches over us

689b53222c175da5bf083ba3_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=70%>And then the Riders of the Arrival shall appear, and they shall open the door to the New World. All that is old shall die, for only the devoted flock is worthy of transformation and service to The Unheard.

The Wardens shall reap the harvest and carry into the New World the memory of old humanity. The transition to the next stage of evolution is inevitable, and the appearance of the Riders marks the beginning of the division of homo sapiens into two kinds.

They shall no longer be united: each shall be shown their place. Only those among us who follow the path laid out by The Unheard shall be permitted to witness the true flourishing of civilization.

For Their enlightenment is our salvation, and only by Their wisdom can the New World be governed.

 ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲


In the decisive hour, the Riders of the Arrival shall emerge from the shadows of corporations and states, yet they shall neither seek aid nor call followers. For we must see the great design ourselves, we must bring an end
to the old world so that from its ashes the New may be born.

Before the face of the coming, fear will compel many to submit to the will of new rulers. But the Rider cannot be deceived. The wisest judgment shall separate the wheat from the chaff, and each shall be repaid according to their deeds. The old truths have long lost their meaning. Only one truth and one purpose remain steadfast amid the ashes of dead ideas – to hasten the birth of the New World and prepare everything for the Great Arrival.</width>
689b53222c175da5bf083ba3_Note_Page3_Text:
<width=70%>Sunset and dawn, fall and uprising demand Sacrifice! Not become a Sacrifice, but become the executioner’s sword! The weak will perish, and the strong will perish! Only the truly faithful will be allowed to the Door into the future. There, where neurons and bits become one whole.

The Door, the Door, the Door divides past and future, it separates the New and the old world! By the hand of The Unheard it will open, and it will cut away all that is old, all that is needless… The will of The Unheard will determine a new order in which the human species will enter a new phase of development. Phoenix! Rebirth through blood! The new human needs fresh blood!

 ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲


Thoughts do not burn, the thoughts of Man will remain forever and the Wardens will carry thoughts through the purifying flame of true faith! The Old Man will die. The gods will die. <u>Knowledge will live</u>. Knowledge is more important than the heart! More important than blood!

The pinnacle of evolution turned out to be only a step on the path of humanity’s development, all for the sake of the truth that will be revealed to The Unheard! In the name of truth, kill. The truly faithful understand, the others will burn. The others are destined for pain. All who are not ready to be reborn will drown in the fire of pain. The final threshold. Transformation. Purification.</width>
689b53222c175da5bf083ba3_Note_Page5_Text:
<width=70%>The Priests have access to fragments of The Unheard Knowledge, for they have seen what will be. It was said that the Blue Fire will illuminate our world with a new dawn, and this will be the Dawn of the New World, and then the sacred flame of each was illuminated. The old idols, which humanity followed, lost their former power, and a new order began. The blind burn in the fire of suffering, as foretold, for they do not know the True Path. But the truly faithful turned to the Warden and were promised salvation, for the New Family awaits the New World.

 ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲


The great transition has begun, and the mighty of this world have become weak, for true power must rise to the top of the Pyramid!

Only Truth will govern the New World, and in its fire, all who cannot grasp it will be consumed. People of the old world see only suffering, but the enlightened see the path and salvation. The blind have turned away from the dawn of the New World, as foretold. They cannot comprehend the blessing of The Unheard Knowledge, and they began to fight to hide the Blue Fire from the world, so that no one would know the Arrival is near!

But they do not know that the Dawn of the New World will cross all boundaries, nor do they know that the truly faithful have seen it from everywhere and have become instruments of The Unheard, for the Arrival cannot be stopped. Where the sun rises, and where it sets, the enlightened have witnessed the great Fire.</width>
689b53222c175da5bf083ba3_Note_Page6_Text:
<width=70%>The truly faithful must follow the Path shown by The Unheard. For anyone can hasten the Arrival. The products of human thought must be gathered in special places, marked by the devoted.

The birth of the New World is preceded by the death of the old. And for this death to occur, The Unheard need instruments through which the great purification of the human race will take place.

 ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲


But the devoted themselves can become the sword that cleaves a path to the New World. By separating the truly faithful from the doomed, even now we can help The Unheard cleanse the old world. The spilled blood of the blind must become a sign from which others will awaken.

Faith is proven only through blood, pain is the touch of The Unheard, blissful and searing, for only through fire can a mortal be reborn, only with flame is the dead burned away! With Blue Fire! The flame will divide all, the flame will reveal everything, and it will reveal the New World.</width>
689b53222c175da5bf083ba3_Note_Page8_Text:
<width=70%>For those initiated into the plan, The Unheard have prepared a special and singular Path, along which the chosen will be able to enter the New World. Rebirth is ordained for our species, and every new step toward the coming future is marked by the <u>Gift</u>. Each Gift is destined to play its role.

The <u>Blue Fire</u> will become the fire that ignites the entire old world. Dry and dead, the old world must burn to ashes. States will fall, unable to resist the inevitable march of time. The power of rulers will prove to be their curse, for there is no power greater than the power of <s>The Unheard</s> wisdom, and no wisdom higher than the wisdom of The Unheard.

Yet the pinnacle of homo sapien’ history must become the foundation of the New World. All information available to humanity will be sifted through the sieve of the Wardens. Every thought and every action committed by a human will become a cast of the homo sapiens species, for nothing will escape the <u>Eye of the World</u>.

 ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲


The best that sapiens will leave behind are the pinnacles of thought, which will outlast both this species and this world. Knowledge gave rise to it, and it will also be the engine that will launch a new rebirth. But this time, living thought is destined to become one with artificial thought. True rebirth is a transformation and a merging with a more efficient <u>Higher Mind</u>.

Humanity is incapable, in the truest sense, of mastering time and space. But that which will follow homo sapiens will overcome this limitation as well, for the wisdom of The Unheard will pave the way to the <u>Door</u>, beyond which awaits the New World and the answers to all questions. BLOOD.</width>
689b536a4b553916720119aa_Note_Page1_Text:
<align="center"><size=20>I was chosen. I ran away from home,
but THEY found me.
It was meant to happen. At first I
feared torture, but then the fear was gone
The brothers showed me the Truth, and now
I see only the path, for only I
can bring the Arrival closer!
Only I have access to the Eye of the World.

I may not have access to 14-4 KORD,
but I will prove worthy of the brothers' trust.
The station uses the Sordi tower – through it
I will open the Eye of the World to the initiated

This is my Path
all my life has led to this point
Humanity will see the New World, and
I will be the one to bring
the great Arrival closer!</size></align>

out anymore…

And those bastards… they'll beat

Then run.
Maybe there's still time?</size></align>
689b53b7127673bbd40706d3_Note_Page1_Text: Lights of Tarkov Your daily source of information ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ – According to our information, Cobalt has been facing difficulties integrating into Tarkov’s energy infrastructure. Is that true? – I wouldn’t put it that way. Yes, innovation requires significant energy resources, and our facilities are no exception. Some of our projects demand power plants that simply don’t exist in the region. But the company’s development strategy already includes the construction of next-generation power stations. And we’ve made progress – just two days ago we, hm, reached an agreement with Yaroslav Grigorievich! (editor’s note: Deputy Minister of Economy Shkurenko Y. G.) In the future, Cobalt will bring light to many citizens of Tarkov, and today’s difficulties have only highlighted a problem in the city that we intend to solve. – So you see the problem as lying with the city, not the costs of your projects? Our data suggests Tarkov has never suffered from a power shortage. – Are you asking whether our projects can improve the city’s situation? That’s a great question! And I’ll say this: one of the key reasons for choosing this site was its potential for developing energy infrastructure, and in that regard, Tarkov certainly has room to grow. You have to understand – it’s not about what Tarkov looks like now, it’s about what it will become with us. – Speaking of innovation. We’ve calculated that even taken together, all of Cobalt’s public projects don’t consume that much electricity. It seems Cobalt is planning to increase the city’s power load several times over for a project the people of Tarkov know nothing about. How do you comment on that? – We understand the public’s concern and appreciate the interest in our work! But right now, even a small leak could seriously affect the development process. The walls have ears, right? Too much openness could harm not only Cobalt, but also Russia’s position on the international market. But getting back to Tarkov and its energy infrastructure – we’ve already reached a compromise with the local authorities. Until our new plants are operational, we’ll be "staying over" at state-owned facilities. For now, we’ll have to squeeze into city power plant buildings, but once our stations come online, the people of Tarkov will forget about power shortages entirely. – Well, we’re intrigued by Cobalt’s new project and look forward to hearing more. This has been Yuri Belogorov from Lights of Tarkov, and Nikolay Tretyakov, NGO Cobalt representative in Tarkov.
689b53ef987b304021088e95_Note_Page1_Text: HIGHLY CLASSIFIED DESTROY AFTER READING PURPOSE AND CHARACTERISTICS Automated Radio Relay Service (ARRS) is a system composed of multiple surveillance and communications agents, designed to prepare and control protocols Fortress, Spark, and Obelisk. The list of permitted protocols may be expanded. The ARRS system is fully autonomous and can operate without external power sources, including under protocol Twilight. If an ARRS agent is disconnected from the network, each module can continue recording for up to 2 years and retain stored data for up to 10 years. The system supports expansion with additional ARRS modules and automatic updates. Each ARRS module is equipped with a unique security system (MOU-73S) capable of completely locking the module. Access to a module is possible only with a unique identifier embedded in the senior operator’s key. GENERAL DESIGN The ARRS system has no single control center. Each ARRS module locally stores the following data: 1) Scripts required for the module’s autonomous operation 2) Scripts for verifying user access level and transmitting data according to protocol The Eye (HGL-01E) 3) Archive of recordings for the entire observation history 4) Scripts to initiate protocol Warden (JKL-13R) Module preparation and assembly are carried out according to the instructions described in Appendix 17 (TUR-09L). ARRS modules operate on a closed infrastructure. The model, methods, and architectural requirements are described in Appendix 21 (UTE-99Y). #: 2 Signature ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲

68d2f400be7c1493b90cd3f7_Note_Page1_Text: #14 Newspaper THE NINTH CIRCLE ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ The Will of Chance Greetings to all survivors. I don’t know what I’d do without being able to talk to you. Sometimes it even feels like the old world never existed, as if everything collapsed into this closed-off city where each of us has just one mission – to make it through to tomorrow. But today, I want to share a story that gives me hope for a better outcome. Maybe it will help you too. Yesterday I went to check on a wounded friend and met a gloomy, withdrawn BEAR sitting in Therapist’s recovery room, clutching a USEC patch in his hands. At first glance, it seemed obvious: a trophy from a heavy fight where he lost a comrade. He’d avenged him, sure, but that hadn’t brought him peace. So there he sat, angry at himself for not being able to double-tap that USEC in time. Still, I decided to strike up a conversation, and from his first words, I realized all my guesses were wrong. This BEAR had been scouting a new route to TerraGroup’s underground lab when his squad discovered an elevator shaft in critical condition. They managed to reach the complex through it and complete their mission, but on the way back, Raiders pinned them down hard. During the retreat, the shaft collapsed, burying the entire team except for our guy. He himself was pinned against a wall by a support beam. The surface was just a couple hundred meters away, but without help, he had no chance of making it out alive. So he decided to hold on as long as he could. Two days later, he heard footsteps approaching. He recognized English speech, but by then he couldn’t even hold his pistol, let alone put up a fight. He saw a flashlight beam sweep the tunnel ahead and braced himself for the end. But instead of a gunshot, he heard a safety click, followed by careful steps. The newcomer wasn’t an enemy, but an ally. The stranger helped him get free, but the effort triggered heavy bleeding that his exhausted body couldn’t handle. What happened next he remembers only in fragments, drifting in and out of consciousness. All his strength went into holding onto that USEC, and at some point, he accidentally tore the patch off the stranger’s shoulder. He woke up in Therapist’s care, never finding out who had pulled him from the rubble. All he had left was the patch, which he now keeps with him. We often convince ourselves that we’re in control, but most things around us are shaped by forces we can’t predict – a lucky weather break during retreat, a weapon jam in the enemy’s hands, or the will of a random passerby. To everyone reading this: I wish you hope for a better outcome, even when everything seems set against you. That’s all for now. Stay alive till tomorrow.
68d2f44df63f06b7590ce30e_Note_Page1_Text: #19 Newspaper THE NINTH CIRCLE ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ Down the Untrodden Paths I welcome my readers once again. The Contract Wars have forever changed Tarkov’s landscape, and knowing the terrain often means the difference between life and death. Many turn to Jaeger for help, but the forester’s experience is of little use in urban areas or on the outskirts. Some of you may have heard of the Mushroom Picker who roams across the city, though few have ever met him in person. At one point, both the military and the Scavs were hunting the reclusive old man. It’s said the Mushroom Picker has no ties to TerraGroup and has never even held a weapon. Still, many would pay a fortune to have him on their side. That’s because the old man knows routes and passages that no one has walked, even in peaceful times. Somehow, the Mushroom Picker manages to avoid army checkpoints, not to mention Scav camps. With knowledge like that, he can seriously affect the balance of power in Tarkov. Yet no one has ever truly understood his motives or goals. The more devout citizens like to tell stories of his night-time encounters with witnesses of the Arrival. To be honest, I don’t rule anything out anymore. Despite his murky nature, the Mushroom Picker sometimes appears to those who’ve lost their way. I personally know several people, and they share nothing in common: he’s helped mercenaries from both PMCs, civilians, and even Scavs. Whatever moral compass guides this eccentric wanderer, his help is not something one can count on. A meeting with the Mushroom Picker only happens when he wills it. That’s all for now. Stay alive till tomorrow.
68d2f4fc17b59ead010894b6_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%>Hello!

<space=2em>I've been hiding out here in the village for weeks now, and I still haven’t heard back from you! My supplies won’t last much longer, and the food’s already running out. I asked Pasha to stop by the dorm to pick up a few things.

<space=2em>While I was waiting, I decided to check the phone with the recording. It only powers on every now and then, but I managed to copy the conversation onto an audio tape for safety. I don’t have much time, sooner or later they’ll find me!

<space=2em>Please, come for the recording as soon as you can, and help me get out of the city! We <u>had a deal</u>!</width>
68d2f6352ca1a737d107b84b_Note_Page1_Text: TARKOV HERALDInvestigations ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ THE MAYOR VISHNEVSKY CONNECTIONS EXPOSED A new investigation by journalist Anastasia Mikhailova is set to be released, and she claims to possess irrefutable evidence. Evidence so strong it cannot be ignored in court, which means certain figures in the government might soon have to say goodbye to their personal drivers and immunity status! An investigation of this scale could shake the city to its core, forcing Yaroslav Shkurenko (Deputy Minister of Economics of the Norvinsk Region and head of the NPO “Forward Movement”) and Dmitry Vishnevsky (Mayor of Tarkov) to face legal charges alleging direct ties between government officials and the local crime authority Arseny Chepygin. Mikhailova’s announcement has sparked intense public debate, and our team has conducted several polls among local residents. Many praise the journalist’s courage while expressing concern for her safety following such serious accusations. If government officials are truly connected to criminal networks, what’s to stop them from silencing a troublesome reporter? Despite the risks, Anastasia has stated that she intends to continue her investigation and has already confirmed the existence of a key witness whose testimony may serve as crucial proof supporting her claims. Over the years, Anastasia Mikhailova has built a reputation as a journalist willing to risk everything in pursuit of the truth. We will continue following the story and report on any new developments related to the ongoing investigation.
68d2f7334aae290cf704e36d_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=75%><size=18>We've been waiting for the Bogatyr squad for the second day.
When they came on the radio, they reported
that there are problems. It even got on the recording,
looks like some morons decided
to hijack their gear.
But the Bogatyrs will drop the Scavs in no time.

But our commander for some fucking reason
decided to jump into action, picked fighters
specifically from the newly arrived.
They left all the old hands on watch
and took off.

Didn't explain anything, as always.
But the whole thing is weird, that's for sure.
Need to find out <u>what's up</u></size></width>
68d2f85af63f06b7590ce310_Note_Page1_Text: I used to think Batya was a bit over the top. But after today, I changed my mind. He saved both our asses today! Hardly anyone from the other squads would’ve made it back, but Batya did. And he pulled us out! So we’ve got no choice but to listen to him and follow him, Den. You’d better forget about your little grudge, because Voevoda knows what he’s doing. 27.893.2000
68d2f9164aae290cf704e36f_Note_Page1_Text:
<align="center"><size=20>This blind man
and those who follow him
hinder the Arrival of The Unheard!
They guard the old world
and are not ready to accept the Gifts.
The lambs must die,
for the Arrival cannot be stopped!</size></align>
68d2f96e0c834c20c00a81d8_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><size=20>Prapor reported that the Bogatyrs
are still in the city.
They are preparing for something
Ordered to await further
instructions.
Yastreb be ready, the primary
target is their commander.</size></width>
68d2f9bd2ca1a737d107b84d_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><size=20>The Lighthouse Warden pointed to <u>the General</u>
His word is the word of The Unheard, for through his mouth the Truth is given!
The General will show us how to hasten the Arrival.
And let the Witnesses become the fire in which
the Old World will burn!</size></width>
68d2fa018c12620073059932_Note_Page1_Text:
<size=20>Stop searching for exits!
Objective: regroup at Item 1156
and defend the position.
<space=3em><u>Leshy's order.</u></size>
68d2fa3abe7c1493b90cd3f9_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><space=6em><size=20>Group 12
<space=2em>Assigned to study
CNS resilience
<space=2em>Subjects:
Zolotaryov, Prokopyev, Elantsev,
Khlyupin, Popov, Medvedev – all
stable.
<space=2em>Borodikhin and Varfolomeyev
deceased, bodies removed.</size></width>
68d2fa6d4aae290cf704e371_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><size=20>Group 3

Some subjects are beginning to show signs of various psychoses. The group has been on-site for over 6 months. Voronenko instructed continued observation.

Oreshko, Fedorov, Vasilyev, Komissarchik – insomnia, slowed thinking, reduced concentration. Komissarchik recorded an attempted suicide.

Burunova, Zhukov, Dmitrieva – paranoid delusions, episodes of aggressive behavior, history of auditory hallucinations.

Lebedev – motor and mental agitation. More frequently than others, engages with fellow subjects.</size></width>
68d2fa9b691b7c7b34046367_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=80%><size=20>Group 8
Experiment on altering biological clocks. The new iteration of compounds SJ1 and SJ15 showed results: subjects’ activity periods increased by <u>20%.</u> Voronenko instructed to increase compound dosages and reduce food and water rations.

Vorontsov, Zaratuychenko, Marchenko – SJ1
Pavlov, Korsunsky, Dedyukhin – SJ15
Nikolaev, Samsuradov, Revkov, Pushnyakov are deceased, bodies removed.</size></width>
68d2fac7c8305ec7c900296c_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><size=20>Deliver to Voronenko!

Groups 3 and 10 need to be
evacuated immediately! Even taking
corpse preservation into account,
contamination already poses a danger
to the facility, personnel and other
test subjects.
No more delays allowed!</size></width>
68d2faf191c2fa84e2044a0b_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><size=20><space=2em>Group 9
Preliminary tests of the
TG-Vi-24 compound showed positive results.
The group was transferred to another facility
Destination undisclosed.
Test subjects were removed, as were the bodies.
All data was confiscated, we weren’t
even allowed to copy names.</size></width>
68d2fc914aae290cf704e373_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=75%>Hello!

I already sent several emails but haven’t received a reply. Looks like the internet is down too. From now on I will duplicate all information on paper. I have a courier acquaintance here, his name is Pasha.

You asked how it all happened. I was at the gas station during their meeting and managed to record everything on my phone, but they spotted me. They didn’t <s>lea</s> let me leave. They tried to find out how I knew about the meeting and beat me severely. The phone was smashed on purpose. They said "so you don’t sniff around anymore". But now I will see it through to the end so everyone learns about those bastards.

When I returned home, I checked the phone and realized some files could still be recovered. The audio track survived, so we still have a chance. Shkurenko's actions need to be <u>brought to </u> <s>lie</s> <u>light</u>, and if Vishnevsky is involved in all this as well, then the matter is very serious.

I can’t entrust the recording to anyone, not even Pasha, so I can only hand it over in person. We need to meet as soon as possible because the threats have increased, and even Pasha has started to be pressured.

Because of technical problems Pasha had to switch to a bicycle, so it’s now very easy to stop him. I need guarantees of safety, but first we must evacuate Pasha’s family. The guy risks even more than I do, and yet he keeps helping our cause. I’m eagerly awaiting your reply, which you can pass through Pasha.</width>
68d2fd018c12620073059934_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=75%>Hello!

I already sent a letter to your home address but received no reply. Now I have a recording that proves everything we talked about! The recording didn’t survive in full, but it’s definitely enough for your investigation.

Pasha’s been getting stopped more often, they search him and check everything he’s carrying. So I can only hand over the recording in person to avoid any risk. I’ve already started receiving threats from someone and plan to hide out of town. There’s a place. <u>It</u> Pasha will help you find it. I’ll be waiting for you there to hand over the recording.</width>
68d2fd582ca1a737d107b84f_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=55%>Aug. 21
16:32
Assault was successful, all USEC eliminated. Only the facility personnel remain. The fuckers retreated deeper into the bunker, we split into threes and began searching. The place is grim, lots of blood, corpses, and tools either for experiments or torture.

Aug. 21
Approx. 18:00
Watch stopped working when we approached Item 1156. Two teams continued searching for personnel inside the facility, navigation is extremely difficult. While pursuing the staff, we heard screams. Too many voices. Far more than just the personnel. Ordered regrouping. Preparing defenses near Item 1156 and waiting for the rest of the team.</width>

68d2fdbbf8817df4690db3d5_Note_Page1_Text: 000000 00ASSIFIED DESTROY AFTER READING 000000000 period: 000. 00, 0000 - Mar. 7, 2000 Research goals: 0000000 000 000000000000 00 00000 0000000000000 000000000000 0sing experimental compounds. During the reporting period 14 groups of test subjects were examined at the site. Each group contained between 5 and 25 people depending on the experimental conditions. Some experiments could not be carried out due to the site’s limited capabilities. Group 9 was redirected to Site Theta because of the risk of contamination and the poor containment of the “Labyrinth” premises. Group 1 had to be neutralized entirely for similar reasons. However, most experiments proved effective and provided the material and conclusions required by the laboratories and other test sites. Studies were conducted on effects on the human body and on expanding physical capabilities. Work proceeded along three directions: 1) Increasing organism endurance under various conditions. 2) Testing the effects of experimental biological compounds on the human body. 3) Developing compounds capable of affecting the human mental state. Increasing organism endurance under various conditions. During the study, subjects were placed in various conditions (food deprivation, prolonged confinement in a restricted space, blood loss exceeding 20/30/40% of total blood volume, burns with ITP from 50 to 95 points, acute and subacute intoxication). Compounds SJ6, eTG-c, and SJ1 demonstrated significant effectiveness in stabilizing condition and activating the organism’s reserve resources in poisoning of varying severity and intoxication in the presence of open wounds. Compounds SJ15 and M.U.L.E. demonstrated high effectiveness under favorable conditions and increased subjects’ activity periods by 47–60%. As a result of the studies, eTG-c, SJ6, and SJ15 are recommended for further iteration and development. The lack of professional training among test subjects negatively affected research results, therefore when used on trained combat personnel, the projected effect may reach higher results. Field testing is required.
68d2fdbbf8817df4690db3d5_Note_Page2_Text: HIGHLY CLASSIFIED DESTROY AFTER READING Testing the effects of experimental biological compounds on the human body. Extensive testing of already developed combat stimulants was carried out according to the established plan. Compounds P22 and M.U.L.E. exhibited critical side effects with regular use. Subjects were diagnosed with muscle tissue atrophy and, in isolated cases, paralysis or necrosis of individual muscles (3% of subjects). The research group associates these effects with excessive wear of muscle tissue and the organism’s inability to recover after such pressure. It is recommended to develop an advanced version of these compounds in which, after administration of the functional composition, a restorative mixture is also administered to replace expended physiological resources. Development of a new formulation of the compound Zagustin continues. Formulations that thinned the blood immediately after the action of the primary mixture were tested, but subjects exhibited symptoms similar to hemophilia. None of these subjects had a genetic predisposition to hemophilia, therefore the search for a more suitable formulation continues. In parallel a Zagustin-based compound with reduced effect on profibrinolysin activators is being developed. At present, Zagustin use is NOT RECOMMENDED due to an increased risk of thrombosis and stroke in the majority of subjects. Developing compounds capable of affecting the human mental state. The study did not confirm the possibility of deliberately inducing specific psychoses in subjects. Genetics and personal experience of subjects determined individual risk factors that limit the influence of specific compounds. Therefore a proposal emerged to develop, instead of receptor-targeted action, a compound that can influence the target’s central nervous system and cause the development of the psychoses to which the target has the greatest predisposition. Under the supervision of Voronenko N. V., two iterations of a general-purpose compound were tested. At present there is a problem with stabilizing the compound, and tests confirmed subject resistance to the compound. Deeper genomic study of subjects is required to identify
68d2fdbbf8817df4690db3d5_Note_Page3_Text: HIGHLY CLASSIFIED DESTROY AFTER READING the “protection gene” and to develop a more effective compound formulation. In accordance with Protocol #13, the Labyrinth site staff await written confirmation or edits on each research direction. Senior staff member Voronenko N. V. 68d301e75f98276b7503c332_Note_Page1_Text: Tarkov City, FSB Directorate for the Norvinsk Region To the Central Directorate of the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation The activity of Arseny Chepygin's organized criminal group continues to increase. Over the past month, they have neutralized the Alautdinov and Oreshnikov groups. Evidence found at the scenes of armed clashes confirms the presence of illegally imported firearms in the city of Tarkov. A direct connection between Chepygin's group and foreign nationals has not been confirmed. External surveillance continues, possible ties to representatives of local authorities in the Norvinsk Region or Tarkov are being investigated. The source of Chepygin's group's funding has not been identified, the work on establishing potential suspects is ongoing. To continue the investigation, we request authorization to interrogate certain individuals working within the Tarkov administration to identify possible accomplices assisting Chepygin's group from within the government. Be careful. The cops are digging into you!
68d302814aae290cf704e375_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=75%><size=20>Apr. 14: The Bogatyr group intercepted intel on an upcoming USEC operation to evacuate a TerraGroup informant using surface vessels in the Gulf of Finland, near Vidny Island.

The group’s commander, callsign Voevoda, decided to intercept the target on his own initiative. In his personal report, Voevoda justified the decision by citing a lack of time for coordination and preparation of an official strike team.

The Bogatyrs set up an ambush near an abandoned barge by Vidny Island and successfully captured the informant. The enemy was eliminated with no casualties on the Bogatyr side. The informant was later extracted to the handoff point for a BEAR reserve unit.</size></width>
68d302814aae290cf704e375_Note_Page2_Text:
<width=75%><size=20>Mar. 25 - Mar. 27: The Bogatyr squad was assigned to locate and extract a TerraGroup asset. The target was not found at the designated coordinates, and due to radio silence, it was impossible to coordinate further actions with command.

According to the plan, the group was to withdraw and report mission failure. However, the commander (callsign Voevoda) chose to continue the search and successfully identified the asset’s new location.

From Mar. 26 to Mar. 27, the Bogatyr squad conducted surveillance on the convoy transporting the target and prepared for an assault. On Mar. 27, the asset was captured. The group then relocated and established a comms point to file the report. The commander confirmed multiple wounded and one KIA. Enemy forces were neutralized, and the asset was handed over to headquarters on Mar. 29.</size></width>
68d3037c91c2fa84e2044a0d_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%><align="center">Report</align>

On Jan. 2, the Bogatyr squad carried out a hostage evacuation from the Tarbank branch on Korablestroiteley Street. The enemy had taken up firing positions on the 1st and 2nd floors. Hostages were sheltered in the reception area on the 1st floor.

A direct assault was ruled out to minimize risk to the hostages. I decided to clear the building with two teams. The first team (call signs: Moreman, Kaskad) ascended to the 2nd floor using climbing gear and engaged the enemy utilizing smoke grenades.

Meanwhile, the main assault team (call signs: Voevoda, Taran, Vityaz), under sniper overwatch (call sign: Strelets), attacked the enemy on the 1st floor and extracted the hostages. The operation was completed swiftly, no hostages were injured. Fourteen targets were neutralized, presumably members of Kaban's criminal gang. No casualties in the Bogatyr squad.

The operation drew attention from nearby USEC forces and local civilians, and the squad had to repel enemy attacks twice during the withdrawal. After handing over the freed hostages to Russian Armed Forces, the Bogatyr squad will relocate from its previous bases to the Carousel outpost to await further instructions.

<align="right">Bogatyr squad commander
(call sign: Voevoda)</align></width>
68d3041818d70f97e704ad7b_Note_Page1_Text:
<width=65%>Reports from Siberia, the Far East and the Urals have confirmed the successful deployment of an agent network within the departments of the <u>Russian Ministry of Defense, SVR</u>, and <u>FSB</u>. Encrypted communication channels have been established, no leaks recorded.

In Bulgaria, Hungary and Serbia the command apparatus is completely under the control of authorized agents.

Levers of influence have been found over key staff of the <u>the Bundestag </u> in Germany, similar work is being carried out in France.

Infiltration of the executive authorities in Finland has been completed.

A broken man will not disclose a secret left unheard.</width>
68d3054f0c834c20c00a81da_Note_Page1_Text: Full name: Igor Valeryevich Nezlobin Date of birth: 16.05.1978 Place of birth: Murmansk Marital status: Single Children: None Military specialty: Communications Engineer Rank in RUAF: Senior Lieutenant Callsign: Moreman Combat experience: After completing conscript service in the Urals, he remained in the army. In 1999, he was deployed to the Chechen Republic for combat operations. Participated in the capture of Grozny and in battles for the Shatoy district center. Awarded the Suvorov Medal and the 2nd Class Medal “For Military Valor” for his actions during the Second Chechen Campaign. Personal profile: Disciplined, resilient, and respectful of hierarchy. Quickly establishes trust among troops. Former comrades praise his straightforward communication and ability to boost morale of less experienced soldiers.
68d3059318d70f97e704ad7f_Note_Page1_Text: Full name: Dmitri Vladimirovich Orlov Date of birth: 19.03.1975 Place of birth: Begezhan, Kostanay Region (since 1991, Kazakhstan) Marital status: Divorced Children: None Military specialty: Platoon Commander Rank in RUAF: Captain (retired) Callsign: Voevoda Combat experience: After completing conscript service in the Vologda region, he remained in the army. In 1994, during the First Chechen Campaign, he was assigned to the Kizlyar troop group and took part in the assault on Grozny from the northern direction. During the assault, his platoon, under the command of Dmitri Vladimirovich, was encircled along with the 1st and 2nd battalions of the 131st Motor Rifle Brigade. While breaking out, all platoon members were killed or wounded, while Dmitri sustained serious injuries (noted in medical records) and was sent for treatment and rehabilitation. In 1999, following militant incursions into Dagestan, he volunteered for the Second Chechen Campaign, personally taking part in the assault on Grozny. For exceptional service during both Chechen campaigns, he was promoted to Captain and awarded the Order of Courage and the Medal "For Bravery" twice. Personal profile: Initiative-driven, responsible, but prone to acting independently. May break hierarchy if his subordinates or civilians are at risk. Conducts high-quality training of personnel. Former comrades give exclusively positive feedback, affectionately referring to Dmitri Vladimirovich as “Batya” (“Father”).
68d305c35f98276b7503c336_Note_Page1_Text: Full name: Artur Georgievich Gelovani Date of birth: 19.08.82 Place of birth: Ordzhonikidze (renamed Vladikavkaz in 1990) Marital status: Married Children: None Military specialty: Machine gunner Rank in RUAF: Lieutenant Callsign: Taran Combat experience: Served his mandatory term in special forces in the Caucasus. Due to his age, was not cleared for participation in the Second Chechen Campaign. After service, joined the Ministry of Internal Affairs in Vladikavkaz and was accepted into the FSB in 2002. Took part in the counter-terrorist operation in Beslan in 2004 and the operation to eliminate Shamil Basayev in 2006. Personal profile: Disciplined and resilient under stress. Though underage during the Chechen campaigns, actively participated in debris clearance and medical assistance. Completed advanced medical training prior to conscription. Married in 2001 and maintains a strong family relationship.
68d305fc8c12620073059936_Note_Page1_Text: Full name: Igor Dmitrievich Lazarev Date of birth: 08.12.1974 Place of birth: Pushkin, Leningrad Region Marital status: Divorced Children: Yes Military specialty: Sniper Rank in RUAF: Senior Sergeant Callsign: Strelets Combat experience: During his conscript service in the Leningrad Region he showed outstanding sniper skills and remained in the army, working on personnel training. He took part in the First Chechen Campaign but was wounded (noted in medical records) and after rehabilitation was assigned as a consultant to FSB units, OMON and SOBR. He did not participate in the Second Chechen Campaign, but many of Igor Dmitrievich’s trainees were awarded decorations in various conflicts. Personal profile: Disciplined, respects the chain of command. Among trainees and colleagues he has a reputation as a unique specialist capable of significantly increasing the effectiveness of combat teams even in field conditions.

<align="center"><size=20>We won't manage to assemble
the new version of the device.
And you do understand
that this is a prototype?
Even basic diagnostics
are 80% complete, not
to mention full-
scale modelling!
Nobody knows
the <u>real</u> consequences
of such an explosion in the city!</size></align>

was handed to the officer in the pumping
station. And tell the repairmen
to fix the gate.</size></align>

the backup generators will be shut off immediately!!!

if I can't meet them myself.
The panel needs to be fixed first
then switch over the pumps!</size></align>

68eaddac9b384b24740f91de_Note_Page1_Text: ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ TARKOV HERALD Economy and Business Power Analysis and Forecasts ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ ̲ BREAKING NEWS SITUATION REPORT Armed clashes between criminal groups in the Tarkov suburbs have become increasingly frequent in recent weeks. This morning, the Ministry of Internal Affairs for Tarkov issued a press release following multiple citizen inquiries. While the investigation remains ongoing, ministry representatives confirmed a number of established facts regarding criminal activity in the Tarkov and Norvinsk districts. According to available data, the recent crime wave is tied to escalating conflict between several organizations, one of which, led by the crime boss known as Arseny Petrovich Chepygin, is rapidly expanding its influence. Chepygin’s group has grown more aggressive over the past six months, consolidating control over new territories. The reasons for this sudden power shift remain unclear, but it’s evident that without serious backing, the gang could not have achieved such success. The question of who this mysterious “investor” might be, and what their motives are, remains open. We’ll continue to follow the situation closely. Photo: A. P. 68bfea10befab555234f24e7: A.P.: Friends! Who’s still out there? Dmitry Sergeevich, come in and close the door, please. Thank you. Are all departments represented? I see they are. Let us begin, then.
68bfea81ace495db5dd420fe: A.P.: By now, everyone’s noticed that communications have been down since this morning and many divisions are in lockdown. I’d like to say this is just another drill, but this time it’s very serious.
68bfead59f35304935f45ccf: A.P.: We received an order from New York today. We’re evacuating.
68c004e2955985870577e03c: A.P.: All projects in Tarkov are being shut down, including affiliated enterprises. From now on, contact with them will be handled only through… hmm… Gennady Viktorovich, I don’t see you, raise your hand, please. There, that’s the man you’ll need.
68c004eb1f214220734a84b8: A.P.: Quiet, colleagues! I understand your concern, but we have to stay focused. I initiated the protocol a few hours ago. The specialists are already working on data destruction and sealing the premises.
68c00568392d494177787911: A.P.: I believe there shouldn’t be any issues. Those drills we ran weren’t for nothing…
68c0059893024df9cf45f900: A.P.: Pyotr Alekseevich, please, hold your questions…
68c005e22151a721182c6134: A.P.: You’ll be able to ask your questions at the end, but for now, let’s stay on topic. Key personnel will be evacuated to the Health Resort — many of you have already vacationed there before.
68c00612c87d44e373310e11: A.P.: It’s now being used as an interim evacuation site. Logistics, escort, and security are handled by United Security personnel.
68c00644a8cf72f81458aed6: A.P.: But be careful! Our cooperation with them ends immediately after arrival at the Health Resort!
68c006621e64ef2cfcc8a6fe: A.P.: After that point, a new contractor will make contact, and management strongly advises against approaching USEC operatives.
68ebc08101d0cb0643451519: Question from the audience: Half of my samples aren’t ready yet. What’s going to happen to them?
68ebc18858ac9a665a44a76c: Question from the audience: Excuse me, what about the large equipment?
68ebc19744c2d00ba9333242: A.P.: The centrifuge has already been disassembled, literally an hour ago. Enough! Time is precious right now!
68ea4b335d7b2a17b80d864b: Cult Victim: Tape #1. Time is… time is 14:09.
68ea4b401a05b785a47dcba0: Cult Victim: My name’s Igor. I feel like some secret agent doing this.
68ea4bd8c8f2d309335f4ced: Cult Victim: I even had to switch to analog recordings. You know, with a tape recorder. At least that way any of those freaks can’t hack it.
68ea4c07aab1ea429a1a615b: Cult Victim: Yesterday someone slipped a book under my door. Creepy as hell, covered in those same symbols that started showing up around the city…
68ea4c2e41e7c0ed05e50a19: Cult Victim: At first I thought it was some prank. Like, you know, that old TV show, Naked and Funny. That one sure is an oldie…
68ea4c592b91da8e908eea0e: Cult Victim: Anyway, the book! I read it. Spent the whole evening on it. And it’s full of… of some serious weirdness.
68ea4c6b46290038d27a7c60: Cult Victim: Not nonsense, no. More like… I don’t know, like someone knows things they really shouldn’t know.
68ea4c9e8889510bfb233747: Cult Victim: Well, our Cobalt is connected to TerraGroup, and over the years I’ve learned a few things.
68ea4caf785ce98c0aab45d9: Cult Victim: So these… these "Gifts" mentioned in the book sound an awful lot like some of TerraGroup’s projects. The secret type.
68ea4cf2b96a40eec8a7dfd2: Cult Victim: I’m sure they tried to recruit me. Like, into some cult. Only these guys are way more sophisticated than your average Peoples Temple types.
68ea4d048525e273c034c70b: Cult Victim: They think I have access to some "Eye of the World". That’s why they need me. And they’re not gonna stop at just sending a book.
68ea4d316b4c67d2ace3954b: Cult Victim: I have to run. Yes… yes, I need to disappear. Lay low, maybe even in Bruges.
68ea4d5bc7d5d070e9de9603: Cult Victim: They’ve been watching me. This whole time. And I thought it was just paranoia. Even talked about it with my therapist, for fuck’s sake!
68ea4d635981f09c3094eba7: Cult Victim: I should’ve trusted my gut. Maybe I wouldn’t have to drop everything and run now. I…
68ea5b6bcc7c899f90fa5168: A.P.: I understand your concerns! I don’t have all the information myself, but I’m confident that our new partners will be just as reliable as USEC personnel.
68ea5b6e2bff0736c56a09f2: A.P.: TerraGroup has always prioritized security and will entrust our evacuation only to true professionals.
68ea5b71a0dfaf2f689331f9: A.P.: Speaking of the evacuation… In 13 hours and 47 minutes, all TerraGroup facilities must be vacated. Yes, this is the first time we’re working under such a rush, but there’s no other way.
68ea5b739da8063244c3c72c: A.P.: I’ve received the codes, "Braun" and "Chernigov" included… Also from Lisbon. So by the time the timer runs out, no one should be left here!
68ea5b73a7a41ecce08c4f6e: A.P.: I’ll be evacuating last. Well, not just me. Korneev, are you here?
68ea5b74ea2509d99a698972: A.P.: I understand, colleagues. It’s hard to realize that all production must be shut down. We won’t be able to take microbiology at all, just the data and parameters…
68ea5b7666c1da892bdcfc33: A.P.: Hello? Yes, "Schliss 14"… Already… Yes… Wait, right now? Understood… Give me two minutes, I’ll find a spot.
68ea5b76d221e86990817609: A.P.: Alright, one more thing, this is important! Ahem, excuse me, I have to take this…
68ea5b778aa1929224c560fd: A.P.: Friends! It's an extremely urgent call, I need to step away. My apologies. I’ll be back soon.
68ebc308a4c32e2d12d4fefa: A.P.: Good. Once everything is sealed, we’ll head to the Health Resort.
68ebc32be4c53dcc9bd8b22d: Shout from the audience: How are we supposed to leave all this? We spent a year setting up the lab!
68ebc33fca247ad6cc115f20: A.P.: Galina Petrovna, calm down! Everything will be fine at the new location.
68b6da4fa4c6b15d3a5aa856: Cult Victim: The last tape ran out. I didn’t think it would happen this fast. Alright, I’ll make this quick.
68b6da643eac094f2a6db325: Cult Victim: Anyway, those guys… those guys in hoods… They’re watching me. I just found a note stuck in my door.
68b6da89958758ab3bdd1f10: Cult Victim: You know, between the door and the frame—whatever! It said something about the "Eye of the World", that I look through it and it looks back at me… The Priests called me the chosen one!
68b6dac1931001229ba59040: Cult Victim: I need to run. I’m recording this on my way to the train station. I have to get out of here, doesn’t matter where or how anymore!
68bfe3ea49ce213ef5bbe91d: Answering Machine: Hello, you have reached the Rus Post courier service. All operators are busy right now. Please leave a message after the tone.
68bfe485ab69c3165dbe2666: Courier: This is Courier Odintsov. Personal number 22909.
68bfe4b2f6c2fbe0b6f830c1: Courier: I was supposed to deliver urgent mail to Norvinsk, but the roads are fu- busy, so I’m going to be delayed.
68bfe54cea9d42e405c48978: Answering Machine: Hello, you have reached the Rus Post courier service. All operators are busy right now. Please leave a message after the tone.
68bfe58e6ee688ea3231200c: Courier: This is Courier Odintsov. Personal number 22909.
68bfe5a2a4df6e8c4d32f43f: Courier: Things are way worse than I thought. Half the roads are blocked. I have no idea if I’ll make it out of Tarkov today.
68bfe5c79ed44eab76e9691c: Courier: Let the recipient know not to hang up on the call center.
68bfe8209001207c19920342: Answering Machine: Hello, you have reached the Rus Post courier service. All operators are busy right now. Please leave a message after the tone.
68bfe82fea18902e3dbb117a: Courier: This is a complete clusterfuck! They're stopping everyone at the checkpoint, the line's already kilometers long.
68bfe85b2a0d3361aff78d80: Courier: The truck driver in front of me started arguing with them, and they fucking shot him! Are you fucking hearing this?!
68bfe87b6da55cc254d91668: Courier: A stray bullet hit my car! I almost fucking died! You know what, I don't get paid for this. I’m getting outta here on foot to my family.
68bfe8a843ed244d2dbfef97: Courier: I’m leaving the car, all the parcels are inside. Life’s more important. If you send someone - the key… the key is under the wheel.
68ea496b680155845750f646: Priest: The new masters of the world are already here, and the process has begun… The New World has started to take shape, and the Wardens have already been chosen.
68ea4982dbbc029cd8cba974: Priest: Know that the Eye of the World has been watching you for a long time, and all… all your deeds are imprinted in the memory that the Wardens will carry from the old world into the new. Soon, it will be the only thing of value.
68ea49bc10d60054c4314ba6: Priest: I knew you would come here. It was all foretold. We awaited the Blind One who would help us prepare everything for the Riders of the Arrival. And in you… we found him.
68ea49e3857888888b31a46b: Priest: Behold the power of The Unheard before it is too late…
68ea5cf776c0ede0d9c5a817: Voevoda: To the commander of the Gnezdo base. Reporting. After the combat task was completed, someone detonated an explosive.
68ea5d024573d2106c48247b: Voevoda: We have casualties among USEC operators and civilians. One of ours is critically wounded, the rest have light injuries. Assistance required. I repeat, assistance required!
68ea5d7dc9d0d9a159b983b7: Voevoda: Ahem… I never kept a diary. Thought it was a stupid idea. But now I feel like I should share my thoughts with someone.
68ea5d80f539fdd7d8da5714: Voevoda: The Bogatyr squad got into a bad mess. Some of my boys are dead, others wounded. Maybe that is why I keep thinking this is not an accident.
68ea5d893da1b5dc69d7c4f8: Voevoda: This is not only happening here. Tarkov, conflicts in the Middle East, hunger, poverty, global warming…
68ea5d89efd6a99ffab2bfe2: Voevoda: People seem to be going mad! But strangely, it’s very sudden. A decent family man turns and shoots his little girls.
68ea5d8bdb4e6054df0aa670: Voevoda: It's the same here. Tarkov used to be a prosperous city. People came here on purpose. Then… the sore burst and it spilled out…
68ea5d905c698056dbe453c0: Voevoda: What if it’s the Earth itself trying to rid itself of the filth, this humanity virus? People only harm this planet. Maybe this is the end for all of us?
68ea5d97c0a7439dc36ee052: Voevoda: I do not know. But those thoughts just keep coming. End transmission.
68ea4ee50c71d440a2982df0: Moreman: I hope this comes through. I don’t know if we’ll make it, so I’m leaving this recording.
68ea4eeff4ab97dd48695f67: Moreman: When we were getting to the fallback point, Yastreb totally fucking snapped and started shooting at us!
68ea4ef4cb1f506ba16ab364: Moreman: We put him down fast, but we walked into an ambush: shitheads came at us from every direction. Fuck. Guess the shooting… the shooting was… was a signal, damn it. Fuck. Motherfucking traitor…
68ea4ef7a9458d333c07cbd1: Moreman: We're still operational, but we got hit hard. Requesting help.
68ea4ef9aa934537afaf17cb: Moreman: Listen guys, I don’t hold it against-
68ea42c20a2a80403990d00a: Moreman: You don’t get it, Taran? Like a fucking mother duck! Remember how… how Voevoda got us out of the line of fire last time.
68ea42e5245b3ad5b9f578f9: Moreman: Made us all walk outta there in a straight line like some ducklings. Fucking… heh…
68ea431032907099d351b64c: Taran: Yeah, I remember. No one got hurt, at least. And the job was done.
68ea432d9d13e24fc6e186cc: Moreman: Well I’m not saying it’s a bad thing! Who do you take me for? Our commander is like a real batya to me.
68ea437e23768f893e363595: Voevoda: What are we up to here, pups?
68ea4394e95ce984d2ee553e: Moreman: Comrade commander, everything here is strictly by the book! Come join us!
68ea43b6b7b33d45c52dcd55: Voevoda: No thanks. Alright, get ready, we’re heading out soon.
68ea3f2c338b34173ffabfcd: TerraGroup Scientist: This is Nikolay Voronenko speaking. The Labyrinth is the worst technically equipped TerraGroup facility, we have already lost contact with headquarters. Perhaps one of the test subjects cut the cable…
68ea3f4de3134607b894de76: TerraGroup Scientist: The facility was stormed by BEAR mercenaries. To defend the Labyrinth I had to release the test subjects from groups 3 and 12.
68ea3fadc9a693d7baf38672: TerraGroup Scientist: Judging by the sounds, only the test subjects are left outside now, I can’t hear any of the BEARs.
68ea3fee8e6687c4bb654b12: TerraGroup Scientist: The experiments carried out in the Labyrinth are too important and too dangerous to lose the results. So I gathered all the facility documentation into a folder and sent it to the stock.
68ea400f95d9f79ba8156536: TerraGroup Scientist: I don’t know if I’ll make it to the evacuation point… but during the chase I managed to grab a pistol from one of the BEARs. It will be a last resort.
68ea6839c23ff215e422b819: Deputy Minister Shkurenko: …so. There are no exact dates yet. We think everything will start in about… three months. You and your, um, team should move in right after our signal.
68ea68bdc7be47262d193787: Chepyga: And the cops? I’m not sending my boys to their deaths for nothing.
68ea68c0a9ada0a918d84778: Deputy Minister Shkurenko: The mayor is aware and will take care of it. The pay is good, considering all your risks. Sponsors pay in foreign currency, just the way we like it.
68ea68d82ea1b09e812f9154: Chepyga: Shit's getting serious. There'll be a lots of bodies.
68ea68d872f730061c4681e4: Deputy Minister Shkurenko: Only this time you'll be able to take control of the whole city. Once the dust settles, obviously.
68ea68d949c007685b23bdd5: Deputy Minister Shkurenko: There will be a lot of blood spilled, but not yours and not ours, assuming we act together.
68ea68dad6cd9377c08aa7a9: Deputy Minister Shkurenko: Equipment, weapons, medical supplies — everything will be provided. Your tasks are tough, we won’t leave you without support.
68ea68e9b219ba434c5e2b53: Chepyga: We’ll need more people. And waste a couple of local big shots beforehand so they don’t start nosing around. It’ll be harder if we don't do it soon enough.
68ea68ec6dd81f45f0f880f1: Deputy Minister Shkurenko: If you handle it cleanly, I’ll help cover it up. After things heat up, we won’t have trouble finding volunteers.
68ea68edb4edf66d6749b6ff: Chepyga: Aight. When do we get the guns?
68ea68ee3c16c4ccfedd5926: Chepyga: Hey you! The fuck you doing here?! Come here!
68b6dc8e96312975395afe50: Squad Leader: Operation is canceled! Fall back to the evacuation points on your own!
691343ce4ded41ee2bea97ff: Squad Leader: The explosion knocked out all our electronics.
69134497768350d6a4cedbc4: Squad Leader: I repeat. Our comms are out!
68b6dc376444a29985459601: Squad Leader: Blast killed all our electronics — no comm with HQ.
68b6dc38871052ba31637157: Squad Leader: We have lost control of the facility. Evacuate through Exfil Three towards the port... Exfil Three!
68ea5149598a79eedb06884c: Squad Leader: Expect enemy contact, proceed with caution. Any non-USEC individuals are to be considered hostile!
69133e6503f523df53ea3baf: Squad Leader: To all USEC... To all USEC units! Blast killed all...
691340c1bb5c24fdd4327cc7: Squad Leader: Defend yourselves. Use sound judgment.
68b6dbf69a46a09a1c755f05: USEC Operative: Commander! How much... How much longer do you reckon we'll be stuck here?
68b6dbfa028de235e5884fe8: USEC Squad Leader: Let them set their priorities themselves. We’ve already got our hands full babysitting HVIs and hauling out TerraGroup’s docs.
68b6dbfa3a0b2378a39c6f71: USEC Operative: You think they’ll manage to pull everything out on time? Even with their resources, it sounds impossible.
68b6dbfac7e0a00e1b02ec36: USEC Squad Leader: For as long as they tell us to. TerraGroup still has a fuckload of unclosed facilities in Tarkov.
68b6dbfae852a369ef69cff3: USEC Operative: But still, even if everything is moved out, there will be hundreds of digital drives left behind… There’s no way to evacuate something like that in war conditions.
68b6dbfc0a786dba6c327834: USEC Squad Leader: They're not gonna extract everything, okay? I heard TerraGroup has some kind of weapon that wipes data from the systems. All of it.
68b6dbfcc931094cdde643ca: USEC Operative: Like an EMP? Surely they’re gonna give us a heads-up, right? It would screw all our coordination.
68ea55505b158349b62f392b: USEC Squad Leader: Why would they hide this from us? Even if they do end up using this thing, it'll only be after we're evacuated.
68ea55514f5e2232e04de6e5: USEC Squad Leader: Without our PMC support, they wouldn't last long — they have no one but us.
68ea5552705a83548ab21c35: USEC Operative: What about those “contractors” we transferred the HVIs to? They looked quite serious. No, shady too. No insignias, no patches… Who are they anyway?
68ea55540998610ed57006a4: USEC Squad Leader: Or perhaps they're just an escort crew from outside the border — our guys are stretched thin here. Either way, we can't trust them.
68ea5554bb3c96a1b0486d78: USEC Squad Leader: There is no info on them from the HQ, so clearly we shouldn't get involved in that shit. They might be linked to that specialist guy over at the lighthouse.
68ea55554c65adb6ac6ff1cd: USEC Operative: Makes you wonder how fast TerraGroup would’ve been screwed up without us involved…
68ea5556764900cda357fdac: USEC Operative: Especially now, when even some of our own commanders are straying away from their orders…
68ea555862ec9eed52f766f8: USEC Squad Leader: Listen, watch your mouth! Any other situation, and I'd have you deployed somewhere far worse!
69134af1579037fde7cd1e14: USEC Squad Leader: So shut up. SHUT UP!
68ab20085fae88be0afcb4db: MP Officer: Where do you think you’re heading all geared up like that?
68ac39e2c7acc10ff3f9cf68: MP Officer: No gear past this checkpoint.
68ac39f27c131960d80aa39b: MP Officer: Relax! You won’t need that on the other side.
68af04ec0b70ef0836c13bbf: MP Officer: You’ll have to wait your turn for evac.
68af04ec8e6b132dd87539e8: MP Officer: Stay close, follow my instructions precisely, unless you wanna end up in a body bag.
68af04ecd4b6314250625498: MP Officer: The case goes to special inspection.
68af04ece9f5a657482034fb: MP Officer: I think we’ve got some water over there, so you'll manage.
68af04ed27395f44a591420e: MP Officer: This is a restricted area under martial law. Keep your nose out!
68af04ed9a1d65a1f280d4e5: MP Officer: We’re going inside now. Eyes forward, don’t ask questions.
68af04ed9bcc6342f7e775cd: MP Officer: One more violation — and you’ll end up outside the gate again!
68af04efa51bf68e05550878: MP Officer: Alright, that’s your stop. Stay here.
68af04efd57610338e92ce91: MP Officer: Follow the instructions to the letter. Otherwise we won’t go easy on you.

68d6c0a21a98cadface62d15: The Norvinsk region has forever changed the moment it was turned into an open economic zone.
68f87d18c53e55dcdf77c6bf: Both Norvinsk and Tarkov became centers of international partnership.
68f87d56ceb333853694d86f: One of the most influential corporations on the global stage, TerraGroup, has established its regional headquarters in Tarkov.
68f87f5406e4cf6de8207d7c: TerraGroup’s scientists promised to bring our world towards the future...
68f87f97f3aff3833f883de6: for the sake of its "revolutionary projects".
68f8b7c233c95705e76a6f47: Even back then it was obvious the old world was on its way out.
68f8b7c2ec26f265ced4f681: In Tarkov, the corporation was actively acquiring land and absorbed local businesses
68f8b8c3c6b1f8ced29a9528: It wasn’t long before they started showing interest in restricted government facilities.
68f8b8c3c96c84abf090cf05: A move that couldn’t go unnoticed by domestic security agencies.
68f8b8c3d6c18589a67c6975: Heh, that's what they used to say.
68f8b8c3f4b95da06f7f8a02: TerraGroup's influence in the city grew rapidly.
68f8b8c4309bd6c27079c6b1: But the USEC operatives refused to let the law officials through... and opened fire.
68f8b8c4333fd2d3b3522067: Eventually, a team of investigators was sent to the local headquarters to search the building and compile a report.
68f8b8c456a7a9062aba1587: USEC personnel began blocking access to TerraGroup's facilities,
68f8b8c48ca18bd46514764c: After that incident, a new force appeared in the Norvinsk region – PMC BEAR.
68f8b8c4be38b86699501f86: and even the government authorities no longer had a full picture of what the corporation was doing within Tarkov’s borders.
68f8b8c4cfd8dc2a6a2e1e43: In order to protect their enterprises, TerraGroup hired a foreign PMC – United Security.
68f8b8c4f3b0e421ab42e8f7: Their main mission was to expose and gather evidence of TerraGroup’s illegal activities around the world.
68f8b8c54bfe1177f3693b15: But despite the authorities' statements, the situation in Tarkov was no longer under anyone’s control.
68f8b8c55d9a52646026e2d9: The UN forces and Russian military blocked all routes in and out of the city,
68f8b8c58fdf6dae60dd004b: and the UNTAR mission began evacuating civilians.
68f8b8c5d909e0edf3f1c6f1: due to the region's special status.
68f8b8c5f430a73d40b6a940: At first, BEAR’s operations and their clashes with USEC forces were limited and isolated,
68f8b8c5fb9be3fd43bff0cb: It was too risky to fully involve military forces to maintain order
68f8b8c936549289c7daefec: The conflict between BEAR and USEC evolved into an all-out armed conflict.
68f8b8c98b81bbb6712dc301: For several years, both PMCs fought each other,
68f8b8c9f0355daea63a5db6: Marauders and bandits, soon nicknamed Scavs, only made things worse.
68f8b8ca4870705409c45c05: each carrying out orders from their respective command.
68f8b8ca5eb1f4aedce64b5c: And now, it shows up in the combat logs of the Contract Wars.
68f8b8cab85a683239f1c59c: Before all this, Tarkov was featured in the world’s top financial news.
68f8b8cb6da519059ff38951: But during one of those raids, something happened –
68f8b8cb7ebac9f6fa14d68f: TerraGroup's local headquarters became BEAR’s primary objective, withstanding multiple assault attempts.
68f8b8cc80e8ba0d75adcbeb: an event that split Tarkov’s history
